content:
Studieninhalte Master Communications and Electronics Engineering - TUM - TUM School of Computation, Information and Technology

Diese Seite ist nur auf Englisch verfügbar, da die Unterrichtssprache Englisch ist und wir für diesen Studiengang keinen Deutschnachweis fordern.

----------------------------------------

Degree Program Contents Master in Communications and Electronics Engineering
Degree Program Contents Master in Communications and Electronics Engineering
Degree Program Contents Master in Communications and Electronics Engineering
----------------------------------------

Follow up Guidelines
Follow up Guidelines
For orientation in the study program, the following guidelines can be used:
- Communications Systems track: Core Modules Follow up Modules
- Communications Electronics track: Core Modules Follow up Modules
Follow up Guidelines
----------------------------------------

Degree Program Handbook
Degree Program Handbook
Students who have started in winter semester 2022/2023 at TUM can download the Degre Program Handbook:
- Degree Program Handbook WS 2022/2023
Degree Program Handbook
----------------------------------------

Module List and Module Descriptions
Module List and Module Descriptions
The module list of the MSCE program can be found here:
- Students who start the program in winter semester 2023/24:Module list MSCE PO2023
- Module list MSCE PO2023
- Students who have started the program before winter semester 2023/24:Module list MSCE PO2018 (Module descriptions are available in TUMonline)
- Module list MSCE PO2018 (Module descriptions are available in TUMonline)
Suggestions for modules for interdiscplinary area:
- German Courses (recommended)
- Language Courses (exempt English)
- Management Courses
Module List and Module Descriptions
----------------------------------------

Master's Thesis
Master's Thesis
Students can start the master's thesis if they have passed 63 credits from course work plus the research internship. For the registration of the master's thesis students have to contact the MSCE office.
Professors from CIT (department Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science and Mathematics) are allowed to supervise master's thesis and research internship.
Master's Thesis
----------------------------------------

Guest Professors in Summer Semester 2024

Professor Sidhardt Jaggi (University of Bristol):
Advanced Topics in Communication Systems: Selected Topics in Information Theory & Coding Theory
- Professor Jiang Hu (Texas A&M University):Advanced Topics in Communications Electronics: FPGA Information Processing Systems
Professor Jiang Hu (Texas A&M University):
Advanced Topics in Communications Electronics: FPGA Information Processing Systems
